summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach to attorneys Jay Lefkowitz and Roy Black, transmitting a response letter and a protective order from the Jane Doe v. United States litigation related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: Addressed in the email along with Roy Black; the sender references responding to Jay's letter from August 18, 2008.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Addressed in the email along with Jay Lefkowitz; the sender is transmitting documents related to the Jane Doe v. United States litigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named in the subject line of the email, indicating the correspondence pertains to matters involving him.

connections.description: Both are attorneys addressed together in the email regarding the Jane Doe v. United States litigation.
Lefkowitz is involved in legal correspondence regarding litigation connected to Epstein.
Black is involved in legal correspondence regarding litigation connected to Epstein.

events.title: Jay Lefkowitz's letter
events.description: Jay Lefkowitz sent a letter to the U.S. Attorney's office, which is referenced as prompting the response attached to this email.

events.title: Protective Order issued
events.description: A protective order was received in the Jane Doe v. United States litigation and is being transmitted via this email.

keyFacts: The email is from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach regarding the Jane Doe v. United States litigation connected to Jeffrey Epstein.
It transmits a response to attorney Jay Lefkowitz's letter dated August 18, 2008, and a protective order received on August 21, 2008.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal proceedings involving Epstein and the U.S. government as of August 2008.
